src:
Taklukan Tanjakan Kelok Sembilan Ismael Grospe Philippine Juarai Etape III TdS
04 Nov 2019, 14:51 by dodik setyo


Taklukan Tanjakan Kelok Sembilan Ismael Grospe Philippine Juarai Etape III TdS

KBRN, Padang: Ismael Grospe Jr pembalap Go For Gold Philipines tampil sebagai yang tercepat pada etape III Tour de Singkarak (TdS) dengan start di Harau Kabupaten Limapuluh Kota dan Finish di Kota Padang Panjang, Senin (4/11/2019), dengan membukukan waktu tempuh 3 jam 16 menit 14 detik.
Pada urutan dua, pembalap Indonesia Bambang Suryadi dari PGN Road Cycling Team membuntuti. Kemudian di posisi 3 ditempati Kurniawan dari Banyuwangi Road Cycling Comunity.
Namun demikian, hasil etape 3 sepanjang 129 koma 9 kilometer ini, tak banyak  merubah hasil klasemen umum. Jesse Ewart dari Team Sapura Cycling Malaysia masih berada di posisi puncak sebagai pembalap dengan akumulasi waktu tercepat hingga etape 3, sehingga masih berhak menyandang yellow jersey pada balapan esok. Begitupula pada klasifikasi pengumpul point sprint terbanyak, Jesse masih tangguh di urutan puncak dengan poin 36, sehingga masih berhak atas green jersey. Namun posisinya belum aman, karena dibayang-bayangi pembalap Indonesia Bambang Suryadi dengan poin 33.
Sementara perubahan terjadi pada klasemen pengumpul poin tanjakan terbanyak atau king of mountain. Ismael Grospe Jr tampil gemilang menyapu bersih seluruh poin tanjakan yang disuguhkan pada etape 3, sehingga menempatkan dirinya sebagai raja tanjakan dengan poin 44, dan berhak menyandang polkadot jersey, menggeser Marcelo Felipe asal 7Eleven Road Cycling Philiphines dengan poin 24.
Sementara untuk kategori umum team dengan akumulasi waktu tempuh tercepat hingga etape III, dikuasai Team Sapura Cycling Malaysia dengan waktu 26 jam 19 menit 36 detik, disusul Go For Gold Philippines 26 jam 20 menit 5 detik, dan posisi ketiga PGN Road Cycling Team Indonesia dengan waktu akumulasi 26 jam 20 menit 30 detik.
Sebelumnya, pada etape III ini, 94 pembalap yang tersisa dalam gelaran TdS, beradu kecepatan menyelesaikan lintasan 129 koma 9 kilometer, yang membentang dari Harau Kabupaten Limapuluh Kota sampai Kota Padang Panjang. Pada stage ini, destinasi wisata cantik yang dilalui yakni, Air Terjun Lembah Harau, Penggembalaan Sapi Padang Mangateh, serta Jembatan Layang Kelok Sembilan.
text:
Ismael Grospe Philippine wins Stage Nine of TdS
Nov 04 2019, 14:51 by dodik setyo


Ismael Grospe Philippine wins Stage Nine of TdS

KBRN, Padang: Ismael Grospe Jr. Go For Gold Philipines racer appeared as the fastest in Stage III Tour de Singkarak (TdS) with a start in Harau Limapuluh Kota District and Finish in the City of Padang Panjang, Monday (11/04/2019), by posting travel time 3 hours 16 minutes 14 seconds.
In second place, Indonesian racer Bambang Suryadi from the PGN Road Cycling Team trailed. Then in position 3 is occupied Kurniawan from Banyuwangi Road Cycling Comunity.
However, the results of Stage 3 along 129 point 9 kilometers, did not change much the results of the general standings. Jesse Ewart from Team Sapura Cycling Malaysia is still in the top position as a racer with the fastest accumulation of time until Stage 3, so that he still has the right to carry the yellow jersey in tomorrow's race. Likewise in the classification of the most point sprint collectors, Jesse is still tough at the top with 36 points, so he is still entitled to the green jersey. But its position is not safe, because it is overshadowed by Indonesian racer Bambang Suryadi with 33 points.
While changes occur in the highest point climbers standings or king of mountains. Ismael Grospe Jr. performed brilliantly wiping out all grade points presented at Stage 3, thus placing himself as king of the hill with 44 points, and entitled to hold the jersey polka-dot, shifting Marcelo Felipe from 7Eleven Road Cycling Philiphines with 24 points.
As for the general category of teams with the fastest accumulation of travel time up to Stage III, they are controlled by the Sapura Cycling Malaysia Team with a time of 26 hours 19 minutes 36 seconds, followed by Go For Gold Philippines 26 hours 20 minutes 5 seconds, and the third position of PGN Road Cycling Team Indonesia with time accumulation 26 hours 20 minutes 30 seconds.
Previously, at Stage III, the 94 riders left in the TdS mat, competed with speed to complete the 129 point 9 kilometer track, which stretched from Harau, Limapuluh Kota Regency to Padang Panjang City. At this stage, the beautiful tourist destinations traversed namely, Harau Valley Waterfall, Padang Mangateh Cattle Herding, and the Kelok Sembilan Flyover Bridge.
